highlights.headline: Coders hit walls, pivot to raw infrastructure
highlights.body: Advanced developers encountered hard technical ceilings within cloud platforms, rejecting solutions like Supabase and TypeScript for heavy real-time data loads. The conversation escalated from debugging API blocks to advocating for bare-metal infrastructure—private SQL databases, dedicated servers, and Rust plugins—to handle millions of tokens. This signals a push beyond convenient abstractions for performance-critical agent tooling. SHAW: "cloud functions and ts crash at scale, we're going back to metal."

highlights.headline: Jeju network sparks vision for autonomous agent economy
highlights.body: Following Shaw's success running Eliza on ICP, the community envisions Jeju as a foundational network for provably provisioned, self-sustaining agents. Discussions moved from token chart concerns to concrete use cases: agents acting as live oracles for sports or gambling apps, paying fees to run in secure containers. This shifts the narrative from a developer toolkit to a platform for truly independent agent economies. MARC: "this is the infrastructure for agents that live, not just respond."
